item.title: #Twinute plans social media silence for Norway victims - storyful
item.description: . @TwinuteSilence plans a minute's silence for #Oslo, #Utøya victims online http://stryfl.com/7fn #Twinutesilence #Osloblast
item.content:encoded: . @TwinuteSilence plans a minute's silence for #Oslo, #Utøya victims online http://stryfl.com/7fn #Twinutesilence #Osloblast The global community of Twitter and Facebook users are being asked to stop using social media for one minute on Friday in order to create an ‘Online One Minute Silence’ in honour of those who died in Norway. The minute to remember campaign has been dubbed the “Twinute Silence”. The Dublin-based group of four friends want to use the powers of social media to pay respect to those who died and the families now grieving after last Friday’s bomb blast and killings. The Twinute Silence is planned for Friday July 29th at 5pm Dublin/London time, at 6pm in Oslo, at midday in New York/Boston/Washington and at 9pm in San Francisco/Los Angeles. The results will be measurable if the campaign gains enough support. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: storyful.com

item.title: Hacked to Death: A Brief History of Tech’s Most Two-Sided Term | Betabeat — News, gossip and intel from Silicon Alley 2.0.
item.description: Most people have no idea what the word hacker means: http://bit.ly/r6Mdaj Comments: http://bit.ly/orSUIL
item.content:encoded: Most people have no idea what the word hacker means: http://bit.ly/r6Mdaj Comments: http://bit.ly/orSUIL The word hacker has been everywhere recently, splashed across the front page for weeks as the “Phone Hacking” scandal at News of the World engulfed Rupert Murdoch and his media empire. There is a sensational mystique to the term that makes it irresistible to journalists. But typing the default password “1111” into the voicemail box of a murdered girl is not hacking. Neither is bribing the police for the phone numbers of celebrities and crime victims. Unless we’re ready to call smashing the window on my Honda Civic “car hacking,” nothing in the News. Corp scandal fits the bill. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: betabeat.com
